Just another reason why I voted yesterday to uphold President Trump's national emergency to build the wall and secure our border. https://twitter.com/CBP/status/1110699854978826240 …

Additionally, Secretary Nielsen has testified to me under oath that further physical barriers are needed to combat the drug epidemic plaguing our country. That's why I voted today to uphold President Trump’s national emergency and his effort to secure the southern border.
There is clearly a crisis at our southern border given more than 76,000 migrants crossed it without authorization in February, an 11-year high.

One of my primary goals is to give dairy farmers the tools and flexibility that they need to be successful. Working together on commonsense solutions is how we are going to revive the industry in #PA13. Check out WJAC's coverage on my new pro-dairy bill here. pic.twitter.com/qwxAU6PuiE

The partnership I have formed with @RepBrindisi on dairy issues is a great example of how new leadership in Washington can drive commonsense change. Continuing to work with @RepBrindisi on innovative solutions to revive the dairy industry will be a priority for me going forward.
This small change to the H-2A visa classification will come as welcome news to our dairy farmers and will give them flexibility that they need to be more efficient and profitable.

It is clear that one of the reasons our dairy farmers in Pennsylvania’s 13th District are struggling is because they are lacking the manpower that they need to produce their goods and get them to market.

In honor of #NationalAgDay - @RepBrindisi and I are introducing bipartisan legislation to address labor shortages in the dairy industry. Read more about the Dairy and Sheep H–2A Visa Enhancement Act  here → https://johnjoyce.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-joyce-acts-address-labor-shortage-dairy-industry …

Americans do not want to pay the $32 trillion in additional taxes that would be needed to fund Medicare-for-All. As a doctor, I believe we can make a number of alternative reforms that are realistic and will provide quality care for lower costs. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-bgTD29QWKs …

Using healthcare as some sort of political football to divide the country is not going to help patients - working on commonsense reforms will. Medicare-for-All is an unrealistic cure. Read my new op-ed in @thehill for an alternative approach to healthcare. https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/healthcare/432422-lets-get-realistic-about-curing-our-health-care-system …

As @VP and I both say in this @WTAJnews segment, Medicare-for-All is unsustainable and would come with crippling tax increases. We should be focusing on realistic healthcare reforms that lower costs, increase the quality of care and protect those with preexisting conditions. pic.twitter.com/PEUM3lGstQ
